info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 5 at 6:46PM PDT until May 5 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by moderate rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated another batch of light to moderate rain moving into the Las Vegas Valley. Minor flooding remains possible within drainages and flood prone areas. Between 0.25 and 0.50 inches of rain have fallen with additional rainfall expected through 9pm. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, Henderson, North Las Vegas, Boulder City, Rainbow Canyon, Mountains Edge, Blue Diamond, Spring Valley, Enterprise, Southern Highlands, Summerlin, The Strip, Red Rock Canyon, Paradise, Lone Mountain, Fremont Street, Anthem, Green Valley, Jean and Centennial Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING
